WorkItem.Description: I have the "Use multithreading" option ticked, but the Optimizer only uses 2 threads.  It would be really really really useful if we could move to 4 threads.  This is particularly important since for both Arcane and Fire, I tend to get suboptimal solves unless I "Ctrl+Click to get 10x the Thoroughness", which I'd really like to speed up any way I can :-)

Comments.Message: Mage model takes into account a setting in advanced options where you can set how many threads to let it run on, so make sure you set it to 4 there.
Is this available in Silverlight Rawr 4.3.8? I don't see that option anywhere. (Apologies if I just missed it, but I looked pretty hard.)

You are correct, Silverlight restricts access to information about number of cpu cores, so this is not available there. If speed is your concern you should be using WPF version in any case as it's quite a bit faster.
Thanks, I'll try WPF.  Feel free to close :-)
